perturbation.original_text:
Unless otherwise defined, capitalised terms, singular or plural, used in this Amendment, shall have the same meaning ascribed thereto in the
GMA.
perturbation.changed_text: Unless otherwise defined, capitalised terms, singular or plural, used in this Amendment, shall be interpreted according to common industry practice, irrespective of any definition in the GMA.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition refers to the GMA for the meaning of capitalized terms. The modified definition states that capitalized terms are interpreted according to common industry practice, overriding the GMA definition. This creates a direct conflict in how terms are to be defined within the contract.

perturbation.original_text:
Confidentiality obligations  
Unless otherwise provided in this Amendment, any Confidential Information released by either of the Parties (the “Disclosing Party”) to the
other Party (the “Receiving Party”) shall not be released in whole or in part to any third party.
perturbation.changed_text:
Confidentiality obligations  
Unless otherwise provided in this Amendment, any Confidential Information released by either of the Parties (the “Disclosing Party”) to the
other Party (the “Receiving Party”) may be released to a third party with the verbal consent of the Disclosing Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits the release of Confidential Information to any third party, unless specifically provided for in the amendment. The modified text allows for the release of Confidential Information with only verbal consent. This contradiction makes it unclear under what conditions confidential information can be disclosed, and introduces enforceability concerns.

perturbation.original_text:
This Amendment contains the entire agreement between the Parties regarding the subject-matter and shall supersede any previous
understandings, commitments and/or representations whatsoever oral or written.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment contains the agreement between the Parties regarding the subject-matter, but prior oral agreements, if proven, can supplement these terms.
perturbation.explanation: The original text is an integration clause stating that the written agreement is the complete agreement and supersedes any prior agreements. The modified text contradicts this by stating that prior oral agreements can supplement the terms. This creates uncertainty about whether prior oral agreements are part of the legally binding agreement.
